title: I Tried Pat McGrath‚Äôs Viral Glass Skin Mask ‚Äî & Felt Like a Walking Work Of Art
description: When it comes to makeup artistry, few names carry the weight of Pat McGrath. Dubbed ‚ÄúMother‚Äù by the fashion and beauty worlds alike, McGrath has cemented her legacy as one of the most influential and prolific figures in the industry. From creating dazzling, avant-garde looks for runway shows to redefining what luxury beauty means with her eponymous brand, Pat McGrath Labs, her work has always been about breaking boundaries. The viral Glass Skin Mask is no exception. Inspired by her iconic designs for Maison Margiela‚Äôs haute couture shows, where models graced the runway with ethereal, glass-like complexions, the mask promises to deliver McGrath‚Äôs signature high-shine, dewy finish in just one application. But how wearable is it off the runway? To find out, I visited Pat McGrath Labs in NYC to experience the product firsthand and uncover whether this viral sensation is worth the hype ‚Äî or just another fleeting beauty trend. With McGrath‚Äôs brilliance rooted in her ability to marry high fashion and everyday glamour, I had to ask: Can this mask truly make glass skin a reality for everyone, including Black women with specific skincare needs? Here‚Äôs what I learned from trying the mask out myself:¬† First of all, the mask is nothing short of stunning. Formulated with glycerin, rose flower water, and a mix of antioxidants, it‚Äôs designed to support skin renewal while delivering that glass-like glow. What‚Äôs unique about this mask is that it‚Äôs applied on top of your makeup ‚Äî not underneath. Initially, I was skeptical since I‚Äôd never used a mask over a full face, but to my surprise, nothing budged or lifted during the process. How to apply the Pat McGrath Skin Fetish Mask Applying the mask is a multi-step ritual. It involves three layers with drying time in between each. To speed things up we used a blowdryer, but the entire process ‚Äî starting with doing my makeup ‚Äî took about two hours in total. It‚Äôs definitely not a quick fix but more of a special-occasion beauty moment. Lastly, there is a bit of a catch: Once the mask is on, you can‚Äôt talk, eat, or drink. Any movement risks cracking or peeling, making it impractical for everyday wear ‚Äî but it‚Äôs undeniably fun. After an hour of wear, I can confirm the mask is an absolute showstopper. While it‚Äôs not designed for durability, it‚Äôs perfect for making a statement. Walking through the streets of New York City, I turned heads and even received a few compliments from strangers. The next day, my skin looked flawless, as promised. McGrath mentioned the mask‚Äôs nourishing ingredients would leave a lasting glow, and she wasn‚Äôt lying. @refinery29 Stay tuned. üëÄ @Pat McGrath Labs just launched the product to get the viral makeup look from last year‚Äôs @Maison Margiela haute couture runway show. #glassskin #glassskinmask #makeup ‚ô¨ Sunrise ‚Äì Official Sound Studio So, is the mask worth the hype? For beauty enthusiasts and makeup lovers who enjoy trying unique artistry products, it‚Äôs a playful indulgence at $38 a tube. For the average person, it‚Äôs less practical, but for one day, it was thrilling to channel my inner Pat McGrath muse. Next time, I‚Äôd opt to use the mask more sparingly as a highlighter or treatment mask, which McGrath mentioned are some of her favorite alternate uses for the product. If you‚Äôre still curious about the mask, here‚Äôs more details straight from Mother‚Äôs mouth‚Ä¶¬† DashDividers_1_500x100 R29: What inspired you to create the glass skin mask? Pat McGrath: This is my love letter to Margiela and to beauty lovers everywhere. The glass skin look was an unforgettable moment, and I wanted to make that radiance accessible for everyone to recreate effortlessly at home. R29: Can you tell us about the hero ingredients in the mask and their benefits? What gives it the glassy shine? McGrath: The mask is powered by glycerin, rose flower water, allantoin, and black tulip extract, a potent antioxidant that supports skin renewal. These ingredients work together to hydrate, soothe, and smooth the skin. The glassy shine comes from a specially formulated reflective layer that delivers the signature glow. R29: Is this mask suitable for all skin types, including sensitive skin? McGrath: Yes! The formula was designed with all skin types in mind, including sensitive skin. It‚Äôs gentle yet effective, delivering hydration and radiance without irritation. R29: Are there any specific techniques or tools that enhance the product‚Äôs effectiveness? McGrath: Oh it‚Äôs so easy! You just need to use any tapered brush with soft bristles to apply a thin, even layer. Always start with a clean, dry face and work in thin layers for the best results. However many layers you‚Äôd like to use is up to you. R29: Have you always wanted to create a mask like this or was it purely because of the virality of the Margiela show? McGrath: It‚Äôs a bit of both. I‚Äôve always dreamed of creating something that captures the brilliance of glass skin, but the response to the Margiela show was the catalyst to bring it to life. R29: Is there a difference between this version of the mask and the version seen on the models? McGrath: This mask will get you the results from the Maison Margiela show in a third of the time, and with some added skincare benefits. I really was very purposeful in creating something that would give you the glass skin effect while making your skin look and feel glowing once you take it off. R29: How does this product ensure a radiant finish without looking ashy on deeper skin tones? McGrath:I designed the formula to enhance every skin tone, leaving a clear, radiant glow with no white cast or ashy residue. R29: Hydration is key for melanated skin. Does the mask target hydration to enhance the natural dewiness of darker skin tones? McGrath: Yes! Hydration is a core focus of the formula, ensuring the skin feels plump, refreshed, and radiant, enhancing its natural luminosity. R29: Was the mask tested on a diverse range of skin tones to ensure inclusivity? McGrath: Absolutely. Inclusivity is at the heart of everything we do. The mask was tested across a wide spectrum of skin tones ‚Äî including my own face ‚Äî¬†to ensure it performs beautifully for everyone. Like what you see? html:
Photo: Courtesy of Cortni Spearman.

When it comes to makeup artistry, few names carry the weight of Pat McGrath. Dubbed ‚ÄúMother‚Äù by the fashion and beauty worlds alike, McGrath has cemented her legacy as one of the most influential and prolific figures in the industry. From creating dazzling, avant-garde looks for runway shows to redefining what luxury beauty means with her eponymous brand, Pat McGrath Labs, her work has always been about breaking boundaries.

The viral Glass Skin Mask is no exception. Inspired by her iconic designs for Maison Margiela's haute couture shows, where models graced the runway with ethereal, glass-like complexions, the mask promises to deliver McGrath‚Äôs signature high-shine, dewy finish in just one application. But how wearable is it off the runway? To find out, I visited Pat McGrath Labs in NYC to experience the product firsthand and uncover whether this viral sensation is worth the hype ‚Äî or just another fleeting beauty trend.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

With McGrath‚Äôs brilliance rooted in her ability to marry high fashion and everyday glamour, I had to ask: Can this mask truly make glass skin a reality for everyone, including Black women with specific skincare needs? Here's what I learned from trying the mask out myself:¬†

First of all, the mask is nothing short of stunning. Formulated with glycerin, rose flower water, and a mix of antioxidants, it‚Äôs designed to support skin renewal while delivering that glass-like glow. What‚Äôs unique about this mask is that it‚Äôs applied on top of your makeup ‚Äî not underneath. Initially, I was skeptical since I‚Äôd never used a mask over a full face, but to my surprise, nothing budged or lifted during the process.

Photo: Courtesy of Cortni Spearman.

How to apply the Pat McGrath Skin Fetish Mask

Applying the mask is a multi-step ritual. It involves three layers with drying time in between each. To speed things up we used a blowdryer, but the entire process ‚Äî starting with doing my makeup ‚Äî took about two hours in total. It‚Äôs definitely not a quick fix but more of a special-occasion beauty moment.

Lastly, there is a bit of a catch: Once the mask is on, you can‚Äôt talk, eat, or drink. Any movement risks cracking or peeling, making it impractical for everyday wear ‚Äî but it‚Äôs undeniably fun. After an hour of wear, I can confirm the mask is an absolute showstopper. While it‚Äôs not designed for durability, it‚Äôs perfect for making a statement. Walking through the streets of New York City, I turned heads and even received a few compliments from strangers. The next day, my skin looked flawless, as promised. McGrath mentioned the mask‚Äôs nourishing ingredients would leave a lasting glow, and she wasn‚Äôt lying.

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

So, is the mask worth the hype? For beauty enthusiasts and makeup lovers who enjoy trying unique artistry products, it‚Äôs a playful indulgence at $38 a tube. For the average person, it‚Äôs less practical, but for one day, it was thrilling to channel my inner Pat McGrath muse. Next time, I‚Äôd opt to use the mask more sparingly as a highlighter or treatment mask, which McGrath mentioned are some of her favorite alternate uses for the product.

If you‚Äôre still curious about the mask, here‚Äôs more details straight from Mother‚Äôs mouth‚Ä¶¬†

Photo: Courtesy of Cortni Spearman.

R29: What inspired you to create the glass skin mask?

Pat McGrath: This is my love letter to Margiela and to beauty lovers everywhere. The glass skin look was an unforgettable moment, and I wanted to make that radiance accessible for everyone to recreate effortlessly at home.

R29: Can you tell us about the hero ingredients in the mask and their benefits? What gives it the glassy shine?

McGrath: The mask is powered by glycerin, rose flower water, allantoin, and black tulip extract, a potent antioxidant that supports skin renewal. These ingredients work together to hydrate, soothe, and smooth the skin. The glassy shine comes from a specially formulated reflective layer that delivers the signature glow.

R29: Is this mask suitable for all skin types, including sensitive skin?

McGrath: Yes! The formula was designed with all skin types in mind, including sensitive skin. It‚Äôs gentle yet effective, delivering hydration and radiance without irritation.

R29: Are there any specific techniques or tools that enhance the product's effectiveness?

AdvertisementADVERTISEMENT

McGrath: Oh it‚Äôs so easy! You just need to use any tapered brush with soft bristles to apply a thin, even layer. Always start with a clean, dry face and work in thin layers for the best results. However many layers you‚Äôd like to use is up to you.

R29: Have you always wanted to create a mask like this or was it purely because of the virality of the Margiela show?

McGrath: It‚Äôs a bit of both. I‚Äôve always dreamed of creating something that captures the brilliance of glass skin, but the response to the Margiela show was the catalyst to bring it to life.

R29: Is there a difference between this version of the mask and the version seen on the models?

McGrath: This mask will get you the results from the Maison Margiela show in a third of the time, and with some added skincare benefits. I really was very purposeful in creating something that would give you the glass skin effect while making your skin look and feel glowing once you take it off.

R29: How does this product ensure a radiant finish without looking ashy on deeper skin tones?

McGrath:I designed the formula to enhance every skin tone, leaving a clear, radiant glow with no white cast or ashy residue.

R29: Hydration is key for melanated skin. Does the mask target hydration to enhance the natural dewiness of darker skin tones?

McGrath: Yes! Hydration is a core focus of the formula, ensuring the skin feels plump, refreshed, and radiant, enhancing its natural luminosity.

R29: Was the mask tested on a diverse range of skin tones to ensure inclusivity?

McGrath: Absolutely. Inclusivity is at the heart of everything we do. The mask was tested across a wide spectrum of skin tones ‚Äî including my own face ‚Äî¬†to ensure it performs beautifully for everyone.
